alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:02PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, northwestern Elbert, western Arapahoe and south central Adams Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 401 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm over Parker, or 16 miles southeast of Denver, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Denver, Aurora, eastern Centennial, northeastern Castle Rock, Parker, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Bennett, The Pinery, Manila Village, Arapahoe Park, Franktown, Strasburg, Watkins, Ponderosa Park and Buckley SFB. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
